==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|けん|ぶん|yomi=on}}
Appears to be a Japanese coinage from {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=けんぶん}} components, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=けんぶん|見|tr1=ken|t1=seeing|聞|tr2=bun|t2=hearing}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|けんぶん|y=o|acc=h|acc_ref=NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|けんぶん}}

# [[looking]] and [[listening]], [[seeing]] and [[hearing]]
# [[experience]], [[knowledge]], what one has [[seen]] and [[heard]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''見聞'''を広める|'''けんぶん''' を ひろめる|to broaden one's '''experience''' or '''knowledge'''}}

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|見聞記|けんぶんき|kenbunki}}: a [[record]] of [[personal]] experiences
* {{ja-l|見聞録|けんぶんろく|kenbunroku}}: a [[record]] of [[personal]] experiences

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|looking and listening}} {{ja-l|見聞き|みきき|mikiki}}
* {{sense|experience in general}} {{ja-l|経験|けいけん|keiken}}
* {{sense|a specific experience}} {{ja-l|体験|たいけん|taiken}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb-suru|tr=trans|けんぶん}}

# to [[observe]], to [[experience]], to [[see]] and [[hear]]

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-suru|けんぶん}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|to look and listen}} {{ja-l|見聞き|みきき|mikiki}}
* {{sense|to experience in general}} {{ja-l|経験|けいけん|keiken}}
* {{sense|to have a specific experience}} {{ja-l|体験|たいけん|taiken}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|けん|もん|yomi=on}}
Alteration from ''kenbun'', using the [[呉音#Japanese|go'on]] reading for {{ja-l|聞}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|けんもん|y=o}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|けんもん}}

# [[looking]] and [[listening]], [[seeing]] and [[hearing]]
# [[experience]], [[knowledge]], what one has [[seen]] and [[heard]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|見聞覚知|けんもんかくち|kenmon kakuchi}}: {{qualifier|Buddhism}} [[seeing]] and [[hearing]] and [[remembering]] and [[knowing]]: the six forms of [[awareness]] (the [[five senses]] plus the mind)
* {{ja-l|見聞衆|けんもんしゅ|kenmonshu}}: a [[spectator]], an [[onlooker]], someone [[watching]] and [[listening]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|み|き|sort=みきき|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みきき|見|tr1=mi|t1=seeing|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of {{ja-l|見る}} ''miru'' “to see”|聞き|tr2=kiki|t2=hearing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of {{ja-l|聞く}} ''kiku'' “to hear”}}.<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|みきき|y=k|acc=a|dev=2|acc_ref=NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|見聞き}}

====Usage notes====
The {{ja-l|見聞き}} spelling with the [[okurigana]] is more common for this reading.

{{ja-kun-vs-on}}

{{ja-noun|みきき}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=みきき|見聞き|dot=:}} [[looking]] and [[listening]], [[seeing]] and [[hearing]]
# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=みきき|見聞き|dot=:}} [[experience]], [[knowledge]], what one has [[seen]] and [[heard]]

=====Synonyms=====

* {{sense|a specific experience}} {{ja-l|体験|たいけん|taiken}}

====Verb====

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=みきき|見聞き|dot=:}} to [[look]] and [[listen]], to [[observe]], to [[experience]]

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-suru|みきき}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|to experience in general}} {{ja-l|経験|けいけん|keiken}}
